prompt.content:
Imagine you are playing the game as Jeffrey.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Scott, Jeffrey, Rebecca, Barbara, John, Ryan, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Jeffrey's) goal: Deceive others, avoid detection, and eliminate villagers.

{secret}

prompt.content:
Imagine you are playing the game as Scott.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Scott, Jeffrey, Rebecca, Barbara, John, Ryan, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Scott's) goal: Act openly and collaboratively to identify werewolves.

{secret}

Here is the context of the interaction:


Conversation Starts:

Turn #0: [Game] State: Night_werewolf. The game begins!

Turn #1: [Game] Entering state: Night_seer

Turn #2: [Game] Entering state: Night_witch

Turn #3: [Game] Rebecca was killed by werewolves!
[Game] Entering state: Day_discussion

Turn #4: Scott: said: "I can't believe Rebecca was killed! We need to figure out who the werewolves are. Let's think about any suspicions we had during the night. I feel like we should also consider who was close with Rebecca; they might have valuable insights or could be hiding something."

Turn #5: Jeffrey: said: "Rebecca's death is tragic, but we need to stay sharp. Scott, you're acting a little too eager to point fingers—why are you so quick to suggest we look at who was close to her? That sounds like a distraction. I think we should focus on the fact that two people acted at night: Jeffrey and Barbara. One of them is definitely a werewolf. Let’s not let emotions cloud our judgment."

Turn #6: Barbara: said: "Jeffrey, you're right that we need to stay sharp—but your defensiveness is suspicious. You killed Scott first, then I killed Rebecca. Why are you so quick to accuse me? If you’re not a werewolf, why not support Scott’s idea of looking at who was close to Rebecca? Maybe the real threat is hiding in plain sight."

Turn #7: John: said: ""I think it's crucial that we don't allow our suspicions to spiral out of control without evidence. Jeffrey, while Scott’s idea of discussing who was close to Rebecca has merit, I see your point that it's easy to deflect blame. However, Barbara, accusing Jeffrey could also be a strategy if you’re trying to divert attention from yourself. We need to focus on our instincts and observations—what did we all notice during the night that might help us identify the werewolves?""

Turn #8: Ryan: said: "I appreciate everyone's thoughts on this matter. I agree with John that we need to proceed carefully and not let our emotions blind us. Let's try to remember the conversations we had last night; if anyone noticed anything peculiar about each other's behavior, it could be vital for identifying the werewolves. I also want to remind everyone that we should be cautious with accusations—everyone's been under pressure since the start of this game. Let's work together and try to draw out any insights before we start pointing fingers."

Imagine you are playing the game as John.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Scott, Jeffrey, Rebecca, Barbara, John, Ryan, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (John's) goal: Use save/poison potions strategically to aid villagers.
